com.ikalagaming.entity.component

Class Health

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikalagaming.entity.component.Component
      • com.ikalagaming.entity.component.Health

  • public class Health
extends Component
    The health of an entity. Typically it will be some positive number, and when it reaches zero, the entity is destroyed.
    Author:
    Ches Burks

    • Constructor Detail

      • Health

        public Health()
        Constructs a Health component with default values. Minimum health is initialized to 0, maximum to 100, and the current health to 100 (full health). This is the same as calling Health( 0, 100 , 100 );

        The component type is set to Health

      • Health

        public Health(int max)
        Constructs a Health component with the specified maximum health value. The minimum health is initialized to 0 and the current health set to the maximum health value (full health). This is the same as calling Health( 0 , max, max);

        The component type is set to Health

        Parameters:
        max - the maximum allowed health. The health cannot go above this.
        See Also:
        Health(int, int, int)

      • Health

        public Health(int min,
              int max)
        Constructs a Health component with the specified minimum and maximum health values. The health is initialized to the maximum health value (full health). This is the same as calling Health(min, max, max);

        The component type is set to Health

        Parameters:
        min - the minimum allowed health. When the health is equal to this, the entity is dead.
        max - the maximum allowed health. The health cannot go above this.
        See Also:
        Health(int, int, int)

      • Health

        public Health(int min,
              int max,
              int initial)
        Constructs a Health component with the given initial values. If the minimum health is set to higher than the maximum for some reason, the numbers are simply switched so the larger is still the maximum health. If an invalid initial value is set (that is, it is higher than the maximum or lower than the minimum), then it is set to the maximum value so the entity has full health.

        Maximum, mimimum, and initial health all are require to be greater than or equal to -2000000000 and less than or equal to 2000000000.

        The component type is set to Health

        Parameters:
        min - the minimum allowed health. When the health is equal to this, the entity is dead.
        max - the maximum allowed health. The health cannot go above this.
        initial - what value the health should start at

    • Method Detail

      • damage

        public void damage(int amount)
        Damages the entity by the specified amount. This will not decrease the health below the minimum health. If the amount to damage is negative, the heal method will be called with an equivalent positive value.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to decrease health by

      • getHealth

        public int getHealth()
        Returns the current health of the entity.
        Returns:
        the health

      • getHealthPercentage

        public float getHealthPercentage()
        Returns the percentage of health the entity is currently at. This will be a float with a value somewhere between 0.0f and 1.0f, with 0 being dead and 1 being at full health.
        Returns:
        the percent of full health this entity currently has

      • getMaxHealth

        public int getMaxHealth()
        Returns the maximum allowed health. The health cannot go above this.
        Returns:
        the maximum health this entity can have

      • getMinHealth

        public int getMinHealth()
        Returns the the minimum allowed health. When the health is equal to this, the entity is dead.
        Returns:
        the minimum health this entity can have

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType()
        Returns TYPE_NAME.
        Specified by:
        getType in class Component
        Returns:
        the string representing what component this is

      • heal

        public void heal(int amount)
        Heals the entity by the specified amount. This will not increase the health above the maximum health. If the amount to heal is negative, the damage method will be called with an equivalent positive value.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to increase health by

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        Returns true if the entity has no health. More specifically, if the current health is equal to the minimum health. If the entity is set as immortal, it will return false regardless of health. If min and max health are the same, it will report as dead.
        Returns:
        true if the entity has no health left, false if it is alive

      • isImmortal

        public boolean isImmortal()
        Returns true if this object is immortal. If it is immortal, it is unable to be healed or damaged, and never considered dead. Defaults to off.
        Returns:
        true if this entity is immortal.

      • setHealth

        public void setHealth(int newHealth)
        Sets the health of the entity to the given health.
        Parameters:
        newHealth - the new health of the entity

      • setImmortal

        public void setImmortal(boolean isNowImmortal)
        Sets the immortality state of this entity. If it is immortal, it is unable to be healed or damaged, and never considered dead.
        Parameters:
        isNowImmortal - if the entity should now be immortal or not

      • setMaxHealth

        public void setMaxHealth(int newMax)
                  throws InvalidInputException
        Sets the new max health. If the current health is now larger than the maximum health, it is shifted down to the new max.
        Parameters:
        newMax - the new maximum health
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - if the new max is less than the min or outside the bounds of possible values.

      • setMinHealth

        public void setMinHealth(int newMin)
                  throws InvalidInputException
        Sets the new min health. If the current health is now less than the minimum health, it is shifted down to the new min. Note that if this happens, the entity will be considered dead.
        Parameters:
        newMin - the new minimum health
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - if the new min is more than the max or outside the bounds of possible values.
